page.title: 18LOCAL HISTORY, RECREATION
page.content: Civil War features in Chulmleigh's history in that Charles I, Sir Thomas Fairfax & Oliver Cromwell are known to have visited the town - the former spending the night in 1633 at the Barnstaple Inn, which still retains his coat of arms. {RECREATION }The most popular form of recreation is gardening. Close behind is reading. Viewing TV and listening to the radio 3rd. Walking, &, enjoying the countryside 4th. Knitting, &, sports and games rank next in popular- ity. Close behind is handicraft etc involving the home. Then music; the Secondary School helps towards this interest by arranging the occasional musical evening. As, indeed, the Community College endeavours to be completely involved. 34 other forms of recreation were mentioned ... church work, bird watching, dancing, whist...
